almost.functional.utils
Class Preconditions

java.lang.Object
  almost.functional.utils.Preconditions

public final class Preconditions
extends java.lang.Object

Utility operations designed to be used as precondition tests.

checkNotNull

public static <T> T checkNotNull(T reference,
                                 java.lang.String errorMessage)
Check that a reference is not null, throwing a IllegalArgumentException if it is.

Type Parameters:
T - the type of the reference
Parameters:
reference - The reference to check
errorMessage - the message for the exception if the reference is null
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the reference is null

checkNonEmptyString

public static java.lang.String checkNonEmptyString(java.lang.String reference,
                                                   java.lang.String errorMessage)
Check that a String is not empty after removing whitespace.

Parameters:
reference - the string
errorMessage - the message for the exception
Throws:
java.lang.NullPointerException - if the String is null
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the string is non-null but zero length

isAssignableTo

public static java.lang.Class isAssignableTo(java.lang.Class<?> fromValue,
                                             java.lang.Class<?> toValue,
                                             java.lang.String message)
Check that one class is assignable to another.

Parameters:
fromValue - the class assigning from
toValue - the class assigning to
message - the message used in the exception if thrown
Throws:
java.lang.ClassCastException - if the assignment can not be made
